By Paul Thompson UPDATED: 19:34 GMT, 24 March 2011
Comments ( 18 ) Share
Kimesa Smith was arrested on a misdemeanor battery charge after she had a violent meltdown over a Burger King meal
A bikini-clad mum sparked a riot at Burger King restaurant after she was unhappy with the service at the fast food restaurant.
Kimesia Smith leapt up on the counter and threw a three gallon charity jug at terrified staff.
Her friends in the restaurant joined in the fracas as they tossed napkins, plastic utensils and trays at staff.
Smith's rage was captured on cell phone video at the Burger King restaurant in Panama City Beach, Florida.
The mother-of-two was visiting the popular tourist resort with friends when she became agitated while waiting for her order.
Smith can be heard on the film berating staff behind the counter before storming over to a staff entrance and confronting servers.
Managers prevented her from gaining access to the kitchen and a shoving match follows as Smith tries to gain access to where the food is being prepared.
Cheered on by her friends, Smith jumped up on the counter and tossed a charity coin jug at staff.
Kimesia Smith is seen leaping onto the counter of the Burger King, grabbing a jug containing charity donations, right, and hurling it, and other items, at an employee
Managers called police but not before napkins, and utensils were hurled around the restaurant.
Smith, from Montgomery, Alabama, was arrested by police and charged with simple battery after she allegedly pulled an employee's hair.
She was held overnight in jail and is due in court to face the battery charge following the near riot on Tuesday night.
According to a Panama City Beach Police Department report, Smith tried to pull away after being handcuffed.
She shouted at the officer: 'Take your damn hands off me, you can’t touch me.'
While in custody, she 'continued screaming and yelling' at a policeman and a Burger King employee who identified her for officers.
It is not known where her children were at the time.
A restaurant manager said the eatery suffered minor damage during the incident, but that no worker was injured.
